methods.ensureCapacity:
Ensure that this WritableColumnSource can accept row keys in range [0, capacity).

:param size: (long) - The new minimum capacity
:param nullFill: (boolean) - Whether data should be "null-filled". If true, get operations at row keys that have not been
        set will return the appropriate null value; otherwise such gets produce undefined results.
methods.fillChunk:
Populates the given destination chunk with data corresponding to the keys from the given RowSequence.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSource.FillContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in retrieving the Chunk.
:param destination: (io.deephaven.chunk.WritableChunk<? superio.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) - The chunk to be populated according to rowSequence. No assumptions shall be made about
        the size of the chunk shall be made. The chunk will be populated from position [0,rowSequence.size()).
:param rowSequence: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSequence) - An RowSequence representing the keys to be fetched
methods.fillChunkUnordered:
Populates a contiguous portion of the given destination chunk with data corresponding to the keys from the given
 LongChunk.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSource.FillContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in retrieving the Chunk.
:param destination: (io.deephaven.chunk.WritableChunk<? superio.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) - The chunk to be populated according to keys
:param keyIndices: (io.deephaven.chunk.LongChunk<? extendsio.deephaven.engine.rowset.chunkattributes.RowKeys>) - A chunk of individual, not assumed to be ordered keys to be fetched
methods.fillPrevChunkUnordered:
Populates a contiguous portion of the given destination chunk with prev data corresponding to the keys from the
 given LongChunk.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSource.FillContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in retrieving the Chunk.
:param destination: (io.deephaven.chunk.WritableChunk<? superio.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) - The chunk to be populated according to keys
:param keyIndices: (io.deephaven.chunk.LongChunk<? extendsio.deephaven.engine.rowset.chunkattributes.RowKeys>) - A chunk of individual, not assumed to be ordered keys to be fetched

methods.getBooleanMemoryColumnSource:
Produces an BooleanArraySource with the given data.

:param data: (byte[]) - an array containing the data to insert into the ColumnSource.
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.sources.ArrayBackedColumnSource<java.lang.Boolean>) an in-memory column source with the requested data
methods.getChunk:
Returns a chunk of data corresponding to the keys from the given RowSequence.

:param context: (io.deephaven.engine.table.ChunkSource.GetContext) - A context containing all mutable/state related data used in retrieving the Chunk. In particular,
        the Context may be used to provide a Chunk data pool
:param rowSequence: (io.deephaven.engine.rowset.RowSequence) - An RowSequence representing the keys to be fetched
:return: (io.deephaven.chunk.Chunk<io.deephaven.chunk.attributes.Values>) A chunk of data corresponding to the keys from the given RowSequence
methods.getDateTimeMemoryColumnSource:
Produces an DateTimeArraySource with the given data.

:param data: (long[]) - an array containing the data to insert into the ColumnSource, represented as long nanoseconds since
        the epoch
:return: (io.deephaven.engine.table.impl.sources.ArrayBackedColumnSource<io.deephaven.time.DateTime>) an in-memory column source with the requested data
methods.getMemoryColumnSource:
**Incompatible overloads text - text from the first overload:**

methods.getMemoryColumnSourceUntyped:
Creates an in-memory ColumnSource from the supplied dataArray, using instanceof checks to determine the
 appropriate type of column source to produce.

*Overload 1*  
  :param dataArray: (java.lang.Object) - the data to insert into the new column source
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.table.WritableColumnSource<?>) a ColumnSource with the supplied data.
  
*Overload 2*  
  Note: Java generics information - <T>
  
  :param dataArray: (java.lang.Object) - the data to insert into the new column source
  :param dataType: (java.lang.Class<T>) - the data type of the resultant column source
  :param componentType: (java.lang.Class<?>) - the component type for column sources of arrays or Vectors
  :return: (io.deephaven.engine.table.WritableColumnSource<T>) a ColumnSource with the supplied data.
methods.isImmutable:
Determine if this column source is immutable, meaning that the values at a given row key never change.

:return: (boolean) true if the values at a given row key of the column source never change, false otherwise
methods.providesFillUnordered:
Returns true if this column source can efficiently provide an unordered fill.

 If this method returns false, then fillChunkUnordered and fillPrevChunkUnordered may throw an
 UnsupportedOperationException.

:return: (boolean) if this column source can provide an unordered fill

:param start: long

:param offset: long

text:
A ColumnSource backed by in-memory arrays of data.
 
 The column source is dense with keys from 0 to capacity, there can be no holes. Arrays are divided into blocks so
 that the column source can be incrementally expanded without copying data from one array to another.
